answer:
It is recommended that people born in 1970 or later (1957 for health care workers) get two doses of the Measles, Mumps, Rubella (MMR) Vaccine to ensure full protection. If your daughters only have one documented dose of mumps-containing vaccine, a second MMR dose is needed.
Find a health unit near  you here.
Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## It is recommended that people born in 1970 or later (1957 for health care workers) get two doses of the Measles, Mumps, Rubella (MMR) Vaccine to ensure full protection.

If your daughters only have one documented dose of mumps-containing vaccine, a second MMR dose is needed.
Find a health unit near  you here.
Immunization Nurse
question: My daughters were born in 1980 and 1982, they received vaccines offered at the time. Are their vaccinations considered up to date now? Only one dose of mumps vaccine was received
question_variation_0: how often do vaccines for babies come up to date now
question_variation_1: can vaccinations be kept up to date
question_variation_2: do vaccinations are considered up to date now? nsa vaccination mumps vaccine
